00379 struct MICROCODE
00380 {
00381    Uint8 core_grp; /* core groups are used only for PX_PLUS mode. */

00383    Uint8 *code;
00384    Uint32 code_size; /* in bytes*/

00393    softreq_t srq;
00394    /* Use count */
00395    int use_count;
00396 };

00448 typedef struct
00449 {
00450   Uint16 opcode;

00454   Uint16 rlen;         /* length in bytes of the output data */

00456   Uint16 outcnt;      /* for getting a pointer to the data */
00457   Uint16 reserved;      /* for future use */
00458 
00459   Uint32 insize[MAX_INCNT];
00460   Uint32 inoffset[MAX_INCNT];
00461   Uint32 inunit[MAX_INCNT];

00474 
00475   Uint64 ctx_ptr ;

00599 /*! \enum Csp1ErrorCodes FAILURE/PENDING codes*/
00600 typedef enum
00601 {
00602   /* Driver */
00603   ERR_DRIVER_NOT_READY = (0x40000000 | 256),   /* 0x40000100 */
00604   ERR_MEMORY_ALLOC_FAILURE,          /* 0x40000101 */
00605   ERR_DOOR_BEL_TIMEOUT,            /* 0x40000102 */
00606   ERR_REQ_TIMEOUT,            /* 0x40000103 */
00607   ERR_CONTEXT_ALLOC_FAILURE,         /* 0x40000104 */
00608   ERR_CONTEXT_DEALLOC_FAILURE,         /* 0x40000105 */
00609   ERR_KEY_MEM_ALLOC_FAILURE,         /* 0x40000106 */
00610   ERR_KEY_MEM_DEALLOC_FAILURE,         /* 0x40000107 */
00611   ERR_UCODE_LOAD_FAILURE,         /* 0x40000108 */
00612   ERR_INIT_FAILURE,            /* 0x40000109 */
00613   ERR_EXEC_WAIT_TIMEOUT,         /* 0x4000010a */
00614   ERR_OUTBOUND_FIFO_WAIT_TIMEOUT,      /* 0x4000010b */
00615   ERR_INVALID_COMMAND,            /* 0x4000010c */
00616   ERR_SCATTER_GATHER_SETUP_FAILURE,      /* 0x4000010d */
00617   ERR_OPERATION_NOT_SUPPORTED,         /* 0x4000010e */
00618   ERR_NO_MORE_DEVICE,            /* 0x4000010f */
00619   ERR_REQ_PENDING,            /* 0x40000110 */
00620   ERR_DIRECT_SETUP_FAILURE,         /* 0x40000111 */
00621   ERR_INVALID_REQ_ID,            /* 0x40000112 */
00622   ERR_ILLEGAL_ASSIGNMENT,         /* 0x40000113 */
00623   ERR_DMA_MAP_FAILURE,            /* 0x40000114 */
00624   ERR_UNKNOWN_ERROR,            /* 0x40000115 */
00625 
00626   /* API Layer */
00627   ERR_ILLEGAL_INPUT_LENGTH = (0x40000000 | 384),/* 0x40000180 */
00628   ERR_ILLEGAL_OUTPUT_LENGTH,         /* 0x40000181 */
00629   ERR_ILLEGAL_KEY_LENGTH,         /* 0x40000182 */
00630   ERR_ILLEGAL_KEY_HANDLE,         /* 0x40000183 */
00631   ERR_ILLEGAL_CONTEXT_HANDLE,         /* 0x40000184 */
00632   ERR_ILLEGAL_BLOCK_TYPE,         /* 0x40000185 */
00633   ERR_ILLEGAL_KEY_MATERIAL_INPUT,      /* 0x40000186 */
00634   ERR_BAD_PKCS_PAD_OR_LENGTH,         /* 0x40000187 */
00635   ERR_BAD_CIPHER_OR_MAC,         /* 0x40000188 */
00636   ERR_ILLEGAL_MOD_EX_TYPE,         /* 0x40000189 */
00637 
00638   ERR_ECC_ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT     = (0x40000000 | 512)+0,
00639   ERR_ECC_UNSUPPORTED_ARGUMENT,
00640   ERR_ECC_OUT_OF_MEMORY,
00641   ERR_ECC_MAX_ECRNG_RANDOM_INT_TRIALS_EXCEED,
00642   ERR_ECC_INTERNAL_FAILURE
00643 }Csp1ErrorCodes;
00644 
00645 /* Microcode generated error codes */
00646 /*!\page page1 General Info
00647  * \section errorCodes  Error Codes Info
00648  * \verbatim
00649  * SSL1.x error codes 
00650  * ------------------
00651  *
00652  *  ERR_BAD_RECORD               0x40000002 
00653  *  There was a MAC miscompare or otherwise a record was found bad on a 
00654  *  decrypt.
00655  *  
00656  *  ERR_BAD_SIZE_OR_DLEN_VAL            0x4000000b
00657  *  Either the size of the request was bad or the read stream input length
00658  *  (indicated either by the Dlen value or the scatter/gather list) did not
00659  *  match the length expected by the request.
00660  *  
00661  *  ERR_BAD_PKCS_PAD_OR_LENGTH            0x4000000c
00662  *  A PKCS#1v15 decrypt found a bad pad value or length
00663  *
00664  *  ERR_BAD_PKCS_TYPE               0x4000000e
00665  *  A PKCS#1v15 decrypt found a bad type.
00666  *  
00667  *  ERR_BAD_SCATTER_GATHER_WRITE_LENGTH         0x4000000d
00668  *  The write stream length indicated by the scatter list did not match the
00669  *  write stream length of the request.
00670  *
00671  *
00672  * IPsec 1.x error codes
00673  * ---------------------
00674  * 
00675  *  BAD_PACKET_LENGTH               0x40000080
00676  *  BAD_IPSEC_MODE               0x40000081
00677  *  BAD_IPSEC_PROTOCOL               0x40000082
00678  *  BAD_IPSEC_AUTHENTICATION            0x40000083
00679  *  BAD_IPSEC_PADDING               0x40000084
00680  *  BAD_IP_VERSION               0x40000085
00681  *  BAD_IPSEC_AUTH_TYPE               0x40000086
00682  *  BAD_IPSEC_ENCRYPT_TYPE            0x40000087
00683  *  BAD_IKE_DH_GROUP               0x40000088
00684  *  BAD_MODLENGTH               0x40000089
00685  *  BAD_PKCS_PAD_OR_LENGTH            0x4000008a
00686  *  BAD_PKCS_TYPE               0x4000008b
00687  *  BAD_IPSEC_SPI               0x4000008c
00688  *  BAD_CHECKSUM               0x4000008d
00689  *  BAD_IPSEC_CONTEXT               0x4000008e
00690  *
00691  *
00692  * MC2 (Microcode 2.x) SSL and IPsec combined error codes
00693  * ------------------------------------------------------
00694  *
00695  * BAD_OPCODE                  0x40000001
00696  * BAD_RECORD                  0x40000002
00697  * BAD_SCATTER_GATHER_LIST            0x40000003
00698  * BAD_ICV_AESGCM              0x4000000c
00699  * BAD_KEY_LENGTH_AESGCM       0x40000010
00700  * BAD_SCATTER_GATHER_WRITE_LENGTH         0x4000000d
00701  * BAD_LENGTH                  0x4000000f 
00702  * BAD_BOOT_COMPLETION               0x40000011
00703  * BAD_PACKET_LENGTH               0x40000012
00704  * BAD_IPSEC_MODE               0x40000013
00705  * BAD_IPSEC_PROTOCOL               0x40000014
00706  * BAD_IPSEC_AUTHENTICATION            0x40000015
00707  * BAD_IPSEC_PADDING               0x40000016
00708  * BAD_IP_VERSION               0x40000017
00709  * BAD_AUTH_TYPE               0x40000018
00710  * BAD_PKCS_DATA               0x4000001b
00711  * BAD_IPSEC_SPI               0x4000001c
00712  * BAD_CHECKSUM                  0x4000001d
00713  * BAD_IPSEC_CONTEXT               0x4000001e
00714  * BAD_IPSEC_CONTEXT_DIRECTION            0x4000001f
00715  * BAD_IPSEC_CONTEXT_FLAG_MISMATCH         0x40000020
00716  * IPCOMP_PAYLOAD               0x40000021
00717  * BAD_FRAG_OFFSET               0x40000022
00718  * BAD_SELECTOR_MATCH               0x40000023
00719  * BAD_AES_TYPE                  0x40000024
00720  * BAD_FRAGMENT_SIZE               0x40000026
00721  * BAD_DSA_VERIFY               0x40000027
00722  * BAD_PUBLIC_KEY               0x40000028
00723  * BAD_IKE_DH_GROUP               0x4000002b
00724  *
00725  * \endverbatim
00726  */
00727

00848 #define cavium_dump(str_,buf_,len_) \
00849 { \
00850    Uint32 i=0; \
00851    cavium_print("%s\n",str_); \
00852         cavium_print("0x%04X : ", i*8); \
00853    for (i=0;i<(Uint32)(len_);i++){    \
00854       if(i && ((i%8) == 0)) \
00855                         { \
00856          cavium_print( "%s", "\n"); \
00857                         cavium_print("0x%04X : ", (i)); \
00858                         } \
00859       cavium_print("%02x ",(buf_)[i]);\
00860                      } \
00861    cavium_print("\n%s\n",str_); \
00862 }

00867 #define OP_MEM_FREE_KEY_HOST_MEM        3
00868 #define OP_MEM_FREE_KEY_DDR_MEM         4
00869 #define OP_MEM_FREE_KEY_SRAM_MEM        5
00870 #define OP_MEM_STORE_KEY_HOST_MEM       6

00873 
00874 extern int CSP1_driver_handle;
00875 
00876 
00877 
00878 /*+****************************************************************************/
00879 /*!\page page1 General Info
00880  * \section keyMaterial  Key memory and format
00881  * \verbatim 
00882  *
00883  *  Key memory and format
00884  *
00885  * Asymmetric keys can come from three sources:
00886  *   - the input stream (i.e. the dptr)
00887  *   - the on-chip (FSK) key memory
00888  *    - the extended key memory in local DRAM
00889  *
00890  * The FSK memory is 8KB and is addressed, read, and
00891  * written in multiples of 64-bit words
00892  *
00893  * The extended key memory in local DRAM can be up to
00894  * 4MB.
00895  *
00896  * The chinese remainder theorem (CRT) is a theorem that
00897  * allows for faster private key modular exponentiations.
00898  * This can (conditionally) be used to improve performance.
00899  *
00900  * Without CRT, full modular exponentions are performed
00901  * (up to 2048-bit). The format of the key material is:
00902  *      modulus   (modlength 64-bit words)
00903  *       exponent  (modlength 64-bit words)
00904  *
00905  * (The operation is result = (input ^ exponent) mod modulus.)
00906  *
00907  * With CRT (on private keys), the format of the key material is:
00908  *      Q        (modlength/2 64-bit words)
00909  *      Eq       (modlength/2 64-bit words)
00910  *      P        (modlength/2 64-bit words)
00911  *      Ep       (modlength/2 64-bit words)
00912  *      iqmp     (modlength/2 64-bit words)
00913  *
00914  * The following are requirements of this key material with CRT:
00915  *   modulus = Q * P (Q, P are prime factors of modulus, P > Q)
00916  *   Q, P are 1/2 the length (in bits or words) of the modulus
00917  *   Eq = exponent mod (Q - 1)
00918  *   Ep = exponent mod (P - 1)
00919  *   iqmp = (q ^ -1) mod p = (q ^ (p-2)) mod p
00920  * Eq and Ep are the precomputed exponents. iqmp is also precomputed.
00921  *
00922  * With CRT, the calculation to  get result = (input ^ exponent) mod modulus
00923  * is:
00924  *   inputq = input mod Q
00925  *   inputp = input mod P
00926  *   Mq = (inputq ^ Eq) mod Q
00927  *   Mp = (inputp ^ Ep) mod P
00928  *      temp = Mp - Mq
00929  *   if(temp < 0)
00930  *      temp += p
00931  *   temp = (temp * iqmp) mod p
00932  *   result = temp * q + Mq  // modular multiplication not necessary since the result is < modulus
00933  *   
00934  *
00935  * #ifndef MC2
00936  *      The key material should be in integer format. That means that the least-significant 64-bit
00937  *      word should be the first word and the most-significant word is the last word. 
00938  *      (Within a word the bytes are still big-endian - the most-significant byte contains the 
00939  *      most-significant bits, as you might expect.)
00940  * #endif
00941  * \endverbatim
00942  */
00943 /*-***************************************************************************/
00944 
00945

01249 /*! \ingroup GP_OPS
01250  * Csp1WriteEpci
01251  *
01252  * write data to onchip SRAM.
01253  *
01254  * \param request_type   CAVIUM_BLOCKING or CAVIUM_NON_BLOCKING
01255  * \param key_handle     64-bit key handle pointer.
01256  * \param length    size of data to write in bytes (8<=length<=880, length\%8=0).
01257  * \param data       input data 
01258  * \param request_id    Unique ID for this request.

01367  *              (MD5HMAC96 or SHA1HMAC96)

01372  * \param inter_frag_padding is the padding size between fragments
01373  * \param udp_encap  0 (no UDP encapsulation) or 1 (UDP encapsulation)

01375  * \param next_context_handle   context handle pointer for next SA.

01380  * \param req_queue Queue on which this request has to be sent.
01381  * \param request_id    Unique ID for this request.
01382  *
01383  * \retval SUCCESS 0
01384  * \retval FAILURE/PENDING #Csp1ErrorCodes
01385  */
01386  /*-***************************************************************************/
01387 #ifndef SSL
01388 #ifndef MC2

01392                 IpsecMode mode,
01393                 Direction dir,
01394                 EncType cypher,

01396                 AuthType auth,
01397                 Uint8 *a_key,
01398 #ifndef IPV6_EXT_HEADER_SUPPORT

01400 #else
01401                 Uint8 template[384],
01402 #endif
01403                 Uint32 spi,
01404                 Uint8 copy_df,
01405                 FragType ft,
01406                 Uint16 inter_frag_padding,
01407                 Uint8 udp_encap,
01408                 Uint64 context_handle,
01409                 Uint64 next_context_handle,
01410                 int res_order,
01411                 int req_queue,
01412                 Uint32 *request_id);

01414 #else

01708 /*! \ingroup GP_OPS 
01709  * Csp1Me
01710  *
01711  * Modular exponentiation.
01712  *
01713  * p = x^e mod m
01714  *
01715  * \param request_type   CAVIUM_BLOCKING or CAVIUM_NON_BLOCKING
01716  * \if MC2
01717  * \param modlength   size of modulus in bytes (17<=modlength<=256)
01718  * \param explength   size of exponent in bytes 
01719  * \param datalength   size of data in bytes
01720  * \param modulus   pointer to modlength-byte modulus
01721  * \param exponent   pointer to explength-byte exponent
01722  * \param data      pointer to datalength-byte data
01723  *   
01724  * \else
01725  * \param result_location  CONTEXT_PTR or RESULT_PTR 
01726  * \param context_handle   64-bit pointer to context (context_handle\%8=0)
01727  * \param modlength      size of modulus in bytes (modlength\%8=0, 24<modlength<=256)
01728  * \param data pointer      to modlength-byte value to be exponentiated
01729  * \param modulus      pointer to modlength-byte modulus
01730  * \param exponent      pointer to modlength-byte exponent
01731  * \endif 
01732  *
01733  * \if MC2
01734  * \param result pointer to modlength-byte output
01735  * \else
01736  * \param result if (result_location == RESULT_PTR) pointer to modlength-byte 
01737  * \endif          output in byte format
01738  * \param  request_id Unique ID for this request.
01739  *
01740  * \if CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API
01741  * \param dev_id    Device ID
01742  * \endif
01743  *
01744  *
01745  * \retval SUCCESS 0
01746  * \retval FAILURE/PENDING #Csp1ErrorCodes
01747  *
01748  * \note exp_length <= mod_length \n
01749  *    data_length <= mod_length
01750  *
01751  *
01752  */
01753 /*-***************************************************************************/
01754 #ifdef MC2
01755 Uint32
01756 Csp1Me (n1_request_type request_type,
01757    Uint16 modlength,
01758    Uint16 explength,
01759    Uint16 datalength,
01760    Uint8 * modulus,
01761 #ifdef CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API
01762    Uint8 * exponent, Uint8 * data, Uint8 * result, Uint32 * request_id,Uint32 dev_id);
01763 #else
01764    Uint8 * exponent, Uint8 * data, Uint8 * result, Uint32 * request_id);
01765 #endif
01766 
01767 #else
01768 Uint32
01769 Csp1Me (n1_request_type request_type,
01770    ResultLocation result_location,
01771    Uint64 context_handle,
01772    Uint16 modlength,
01773    Uint8 * data,
01774    Uint8 * modulus,
01775 #ifdef CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API

01779 #endif

01784 /*+****************************************************************************/
01785 /*! \ingroup GP_OPS 
01786  * Csp1Pkcs1v15Enc
01787  *
01788  * Creates PKCS#1v1.5 container.
01789  *
01790  * \param request_type   CAVIUM_BLOCKING or CAVIUM_NON_BLOCKING
01791  * \if MC2
01792  * \param block_type   type of PKCS#1v1.5 padding (BT1 or BT2)
01793  * \param modlength   size of modulus in bytes (17 <= modlength <= 256)
01794  * \param explength   size of exponent in bytes (explength <= modlength -11)
01795  * \param datalength   size of data in bytes (datalength <= modlength -11)
01796  * \param modulus   pointer to modlength-byte modulus
01797  * \param exponent   pointer to explength-byte exponent
01798  * \param data      pointer to datalength-byte data
01799  * \else
01800  * \param result_location    CONTEXT_PTR or RESULT_PTR 
01801  * \param context_handle     64-bit pointer to context (context_handle\%8=0)
01802  * \param key_material_input KEY_HANDLE or INPUT_DATA
01803  * \param key_handle        64-bit handle for key memory 
01804  * \param block_type        type of PKCS#1v1.5 padding (BT1 or BT2)
01805  * \param modlength        size of modulus in bytes (modlength\%8=0, 24<=modlength<=256)
01806  * \param modulus        (key_material_input == INPUT_DATA) ? pointer to RSA modulus : don't care
01807  * \param exponent        (key_material_input == INPUT_DATA) ? pointer to RSA exponent : don't care
01808  * \param length        size of the input value 
01809  * \param data           pointer to length-byte value to be exponentiated
01810  * \endif
01811  *
01812  * 
01813  * \if MC2
01814  * \param result   pointer to modlength bytes of output
01815  * \else
01816  * \param result   (result_location == RESULT_PTR) ? (pointer to modlength bytes of output: don't care)
01817  * \endif 
01818  * \param request_id   Unique ID for this request.
01819  *
01820  * \if CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API
01821  * \param dev_id    Device ID
01822  * \endif
01823  *
01824  * \retval SUCCESS 0
01825  * \retval FAILURE/PENDING #Csp1ErrorCodes
01826  *
01827  */
01828 /*-***************************************************************************/
01829 #ifdef MC2
01830 Uint32
01831 Csp1Pkcs1v15Enc (n1_request_type request_type,
01832        RsaBlockType block_type,
01833        Uint16 modlength,
01834        Uint16 explength,
01835        Uint16 datalength,
01836        Uint8 * modulus,
01837        Uint8 * exponent,
01838 #ifdef CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API
01839        Uint8 * data, Uint8 * result, Uint32 * request_id,Uint32 dev_id);
01840 #else
01841        Uint8 * data, Uint8 * result, Uint32 * request_id);
01842 #endif
01843 
01844 #else
01845 Uint32
01846 Csp1Pkcs1v15Enc (n1_request_type request_type,
01847        ResultLocation result_location,
01848        Uint64 context_handle,

01850        Uint64 key_handle,

01865 /*+****************************************************************************/
01866 /*! \ingroup GP_OPS
01867  * Csp1Pkcs1v15CrtEnc
01868  *
01869  * Creates PKCS#1v1.5 container using the Chinese Remainder Theorem.
01870  * The combination of block type BT2 and CRT may produce unpredictable results.
01871  *
01872  * \param request_type   CAVIUM_BLOCKING or CAVIUM_NON_BLOCKING
01873  * \if MC2
01874  * \param block_type   type of PKCS#1v1.5 padding (BT1 only)
01875  * \param modlength   size of modulus in bytes (34 <= modlength <=256, modlength\%2 !=0)
01876  * \param datalength   size of input data in bytes (datalength <= modlength -11).
01877  * \param Q      prime factor of RSA modulus
01878  * \param Eq      exponent mod(Q-1)
01879  * \param P      prime factor of RSA modulus
01880  * \param Ep      exponent mod(P-1)
01881  * \param iqmp      (Q^-1) mod P
01882  * \else
01883  * \param result_location     CONTEXT_PTR or RESULT_PTR 
01884  * \param context_handle      64-bit pointer to context (context_handle\%8=0)
01885  * \param key_material_input  KEY_HANDLE or INPUT_DATA
01886  * \param key_handle         64-bit handle for key memory 
01887  * \param block_type         type of PKCS#1v1.5 padding (BT1 only)
01888  * \param modlength         size of modulus in bytes (modlength\%8=0, 48<=modlength<=256)
01889  * \param Q            (key_material_input == INPUT_DATA) ? prime factor of RSA modulus : don't care
01890  * \param Eq            (key_material_input == INPUT_DATA) ? exponent mod(Q-1) : don't care
01891  * \param P            (key_material_input == INPUT_DATA) ? prime factor of RSA modulus : don't care
01892  * \param Ep            (key_material_input == INPUT_DATA) ? exponent mod(P-1) : don't care
01893  * \param iqmp            (key_material_input == INPUT_DATA) ? (Q^-1) mod P : don't care
01894  * \param length         size of the input value 
01895  * \endif
01896  * \param data pointer to length-byte value to be exponentiated
01897  *
01898  * \if MC2
01899  * \param result     pointer to modlength bytes of output
01900  * \else
01901  * \param result   (result_location == RESULT_PTR) ? (pointer to modlength bytes of output : don't care
01902  * \endif
01903  * \param request_id   Unique ID for this request.
01904  * 
01905  * \if CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API
01906  * \param dev_id    Device ID
01907  * \endif
01908  *
01909  *
01910  * \retval SUCCESS 0
01911  * \retval FAILURE/PENDING #Csp1ErrorCodes
01912  *
01913  * \note modlength must be even
01914  */
01915 /*-***************************************************************************/
01916 #ifdef MC2
01917 Uint32
01918 Csp1Pkcs1v15CrtEnc (n1_request_type request_type,
01919           RsaBlockType block_type,
01920           Uint16 modlength,
01921           Uint16 datalength,
01922           Uint8 * Q,
01923           Uint8 * Eq,
01924           Uint8 * P,
01925           Uint8 * Ep,
01926           Uint8 * iqmp,
01927 #ifdef CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API
01928           Uint8 * data, Uint8 * result, Uint32 * request_id,Uint32 dev_id);
01929 #else
01930           Uint8 * data, Uint8 * result, Uint32 * request_id);
01931 #endif
01932 
01933 #else
01934 Uint32
01935 Csp1Pkcs1v15CrtEnc (n1_request_type request_type,
01936           ResultLocation result_location,
01937           Uint64 context_handle,
01938           KeyMaterialInput key_material_input,
01939           Uint64 key_handle,
01940           RsaBlockType block_type,
01941           Uint16 modlength,
01942           Uint8 * Q,
01943           Uint8 * Eq,
01944           Uint8 * P,
01945           Uint8 * Ep,
01946           Uint8 * iqmp,
01947           Uint16 length,
01948 #ifdef CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API
01949           Uint8 * data, Uint8 * result, Uint32 * request_id,Uint32 dev_id);
01950 #else
01951           Uint8 * data, Uint8 * result, Uint32 * request_id);
01952 #endif
01953 
01954 #endif
01955

01957 /*+****************************************************************************/
01958 /*! \ingroup GP_OPS
01959  * Csp1Pkcs1v15Dec
01960  *
01961  * Decrypts PKCS#1v1.5 container.
01962  *
01963  *
01964  * \param request_type   CAVIUM_BLOCKING or CAVIUM_NON_BLOCKING
01965  * \if MC2
01966  * \param block_type   type of PKCS#1v1.5 padding (BT1 only)
01967  * \param modlength   size of modulus in bytes (17 <= modlength <=256)
01968  * \param explength   size of exponent in bytes (explength <= modlength - 11)
01969  * \param modulus   pointer to modlength-byte modulus
01970  * \param exponent   pointer to explength-byte exponent
01971  * \param data      pointer to modlength-11 bytes input
01972  * \else
01973  * \param result_location      CONTEXT_PTR or RESULT_PTR 
01974  * \param context_handle      64-bit pointer to context (context_handle\%8=0)
01975  * \param key_material_input      KEY_HANDLE or INPUT_DATA
01976  * \param key_handle         64-bit handle for key memory 
01977  * \param block_type         type of PKCS#1v1.5 padding (BT1 or BT2)
01978  * \param modlength         size of modulus in bytes (modlength\%8=0, 24<=modlength<=256)
01979  * \param modulus         (key_material_input == INPUT_DATA) ? pointer to RSA modulus : don't care
01980  * \param exponent         (key_material_input == INPUT_DATA) ? pointer to RSA exponent : don't care
01981  * \param data            pointer to modlength-byte value to be exponentiated
01982  * \endif
01983  *
01984  * \if MC2
01985  * \param out_length   size of decrypted data in Network Byte order.
01986  * \param result   out_length byte size result
01987  * \else
01988  * \param result   (result_location == RESULT_PTR) ? (pointer to modlength bytes of output, 
01989  *             *out_length bytes used) : don't care
01990  * \param out_length   pointer to output length in bytes
01991  * \endif
01992  * \param request_id   Unique ID for this request.
01993  *
01994  * \if CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API
01995  * \param dev_id    Device ID
01996  * \endif
01997  *
01998  * \retval SUCCESS 0
01999  * \retval FAILURE/PENDING #Csp1ErrorCodes
02000  */
02001 /*-***************************************************************************/
02002 #ifdef MC2
02003 Uint32
02004 Csp1Pkcs1v15Dec (n1_request_type request_type,
02005        RsaBlockType block_type,
02006        Uint16 modlength,
02007        Uint16 explength,
02008        Uint8 * modulus,
02009        Uint8 * exponent,
02010        Uint8 * data,
02011 #ifdef CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API
02012        Uint16 * out_length, Uint8 * result, Uint32 * request_id,Uint32 dev_id);
02013 #else
02014        Uint16 * out_length, Uint8 * result, Uint32 * request_id);
02015 #endif
02016 
02017 #else
02018 Uint32
02019 Csp1Pkcs1v15Dec (n1_request_type request_type,
02020        ResultLocation result_location,
02021        Uint64 context_handle,
02022        KeyMaterialInput key_material_input,
02023        Uint64 key_handle,
02024        RsaBlockType block_type,
02025        Uint16 modlength,
02026        Uint8 * modulus,

02028        Uint8 * data,

02042  * The combination of block type 01 and CRT may produce unpredictable results.
02043  *

02045  * \if MC2

02051  * \param Ep      exponent mod(P-1)

02054  * \else

02058  * \param key_handle         64-bit handle for key memory

02449 /*+****************************************************************************/
02450 /*! \ingroup GP_OPS
02451  * Csp1ProcessSrtp
02452  * Performs SRTP (Secure Real Time Protocol) AES-CTR (Counter mode) Encrypt/Decrypt
02453  *           and Authentication in Single Pass.
02454  * \param request_type      CAVIUM_BLOCKING or CAVIUM_NON_BLOCKING
02455  * \param encrypt           0 - encrypt, 1 -decrypt
02456  * \param keytype           AES_128, AES_192, or AES_256
02457  * \param authtype          NULL or SHA1 
02458 <<<<<<< cavium_common.h
02459  * \param in_len            size of input in bytes (0<=length<=2^16-1)
02460 =======
02461  * \param proto             0 - SRTP, 1 - SRTCP
02462  * \param in_len            size of input in bytes (0<=length<=2^16-1)
02463 >>>>>>> 1.44
02464  * \param hdr_ln            size of the hdr in bytes (0 <= hdr_ln <= 72)
02465  * \param index_ln          size of the Tag len [7:4] and Index len[3:0] in bytes (0 <= index_ln <= 4)
02466  * \param iv                pointer to 16- byte IV
02467  * \param key               pointer to key depending upon aes type
02468  * \param auth_key          pointer to auth_key depending upon auth type
02469  * \param index             pointer to index depending upon index_ln
02470  * \param auth_tag          pointer to auth_tag depending upon auth type & encrypt
02471  * \param input             pointer to ROUNDUP8(length) + ROUNDUP8(hdr_ln) bytes input
02472  *
02473  * \param output            pointer to length + ( proto ? Index_ln : 0) + auth_tag[(auth_type&!encrypt)? Tag len : 0] output
02474  * \param request_id        Unique ID for this request.
02475  *
02476  * \if CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API
02477  * \param dev_id    Device ID
02478  * \endif
02479  *
02480  * \retval SUCCESS 0
02481  * \retval FAILURE/PENDING #Csp1ErrorCodes
02482  *
02483  */
02484 /*-***************************************************************************/
02485 
02486 #ifdef MC2
02487 Uint32
02488 Csp1ProcessSrtp(n1_request_type request_type,
02489                 Uint8 encrypt,
02490                 Uint8 keytype,
02491                 Uint8 authtype,
02492                 Uint8 proto,
02493                 Uint16 in_len,
02494                 Uint8 hdr_ln,
02495                 Uint8 index_ln,
02496                 Uint8 *iv,
02497                 Uint8 *key,
02498                 Uint8 *auth_key,
02499                 Uint8 *index,
02500                 Uint8 *auth_tag,
02501                 Uint8 *input,
02502                 Uint8 *output,
02503 #ifdef CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API
02504                 Uint32 *request_id,Uint32 dev_id
02505 #else
02506                 Uint32 *request_id
02507 #endif
02508                 );
02509 #endif

02642  * \endif

02739 /*+****************************************************************************/
02740 /*! \ingroup GP_OPS
02741  * Csp1EncryptAesGcmGmac
02742  *
02743  *  Encrypts+Authenticates/authenticates the data provided at input 
02744  *  with the key initialized in the context.
02745  *
02746  * \param request_type      CAVIUM_BLOCKING or CAVIUM_NON_BLOCKING
02747  * \param context_handle   64-bit pointer to context (context_handle\%8=0)
02748  * \param context_update   UPDATE or NO_UPDATE
02749  * \param aes_type      AES_128, AES_192, or AES_256
02750  * \param length      size of input in bytes (0<=length<=2^16-1)
02751  * \param input         pointer to length-byte input
02752  * \param aad         pointer to aditional authentication data
02753  *                    (aad length includes SPI and sequence number (8Bytes).
02754  *                    and + 4 bytes if esequence number is implemented) in case
02755  *                    of GCM. In GMAC, input length is 0, the payload data is 
02756  *                    included in the AAD data.
02757  * \param eseqnumber   when = 1, extended sequence number is included in AAD.
02758  * \param gcm_gmac_bit  when set, gmac is done
02759  * \if MC2
02760  * \param iv      pointer to 16- byte IV
02761  * \param key      pointer to key depending upon aes type
02762  * \endif
02763  *
02764  * \param output   pointer to ROUNDUP16(length)-byte output
02765  * \param request_id   Unique ID for this request.
02766  *
02767  * \if CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API
02768  * \param dev_id    Device ID
02769  * \endif
02770  *
02771  * \retval SUCCESS 0
02772  * \retval FAILURE/PENDING #Csp1ErrorCodes
02773  *
02774  */
02775 /*-***************************************************************************/
02776 Uint32
02777 Csp1EncryptAesGcmGmac (n1_request_type request_type,
02778       Uint64 context_handle,
02779       ContextUpdate context_update,
02780       AesType aes_type,
02781       Uint16 length,
02782       Uint8 *input,
02783       Uint8 *aad,
02784       Uint8 eseqnumber,
02785       Uint8 *output, Uint8 gcm_gmac_bit, Uint8 *iv, Uint8 *key, 
02786 #ifdef CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API
02787       Uint32 *request_id,Uint32 dev_id
02788 #else
02789       Uint32 *request_id
02790 #endif
02791       );
02792 
02793 /*+****************************************************************************
02794  *
02795  * Csp1DecryptAesGcm
02796  *
02797  * Input
02798  *      request_type = CAVIUM_BLOCKING or CAVIUM_NON_BLOCKING
02799  *      context_handle = 64-bit pointer to context (context_handle%8=0)
02800  *      context_update = UPDATE or NO_UPDATE
02801  *      aes_type     = AES_128, AES_192, or AES_256
02802  *      length       = size of input in bytes (length%16=0, 0<=length<=2^16-1)
02803  *      input        = pointer to length-byte input in case of GCM
02804  *      eseqnum      = extented sequence number bit
02805  *      tag_length   = can be 4, 8. 12 and 16B
02806  *      aad          = pointer to AAD data incase of GCM, 
02807  *                     pointer to length-byte AAD in GMAC
02808  *      output       = pointer to length-byte output in GCM, 
02809  *                     pointer to 0B output in case of GMAC. 
02810  *      gcm_gmac_bit = set if GMAC, otherwise GCM
02811  *      iv = pointer to 16- byte IV
02812  *      key = pointer to key depending upon aes type
02813  *
02814  * Output
02815  *      output = pointer to length-byte output
02816  *      request_id = Unique ID for this request.
02817  *
02818 <<<<<<< cavium_common.h
02819  * \if CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API
02820  *      dev_id  = Device ID
02821  * \endif
02822  *
02823 =======
02824  * \if CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API
02825  *      dev_id = Device ID
02826  * \endif
02827  *
02828 >>>>>>> 1.44
02829  * Return Value
02830  *   0  = success 
02831  * >0 = failure or pending
02832  * see error_codes.txt
02833  *
02834  *-***************************************************************************/
02835 
02836 Uint32 
02837 Csp1DecryptAesGcm(n1_request_type request_type,
02838             Uint64 context_handle, 
02839             ContextUpdate context_update, 
02840             AesType aes_type, 
02841             Uint16 length, 
02842             Uint8 *input, 
02843             Uint8 eseqnumber,           
02844             Uint16 tag_length,
02845             Uint8 *aad,
02846             Uint8 *output,
02847             Uint8 gcm_gmac_bit,
02848             Uint8 *iv,
02849             Uint8 *key,
02850                  
02851 #ifdef CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API
02852             Uint32 *request_id,Uint32 dev_id
02853 #else
02854             Uint32 *request_id
02855 #endif
02856            );
02857 #endif

02859 #ifdef MC2
02860 /*+****************************************************************************
02861  *
02862  * Csp1Hash
02863  *
02864  * Compute the HASH of a complete message. Does not use context.
02865  *
02866  * \param request_type  CAVIUM_BLOCKING or CAVIUM_NON_BLOCKING
02867  * \param hash_type MD5_TYPE or SHA1_TYPE or SHA256_TYPE

02869  * \param message   pointer to length bytes of input to be HMACed
02870  * \param hash  pointer to the hash_size HASH result 
02871  * \param request_id    Unique ID for this request.

02874  * \param dev_id    Device ID
02875  * \endif
02876  *
02877  * \retval SUCCESS 0
02878  * \retval FAILURE/PENDING #Csp1ErrorCodes
02879  */
02880  /*-***************************************************************************/

02883     HashType hash_type, 
02884     Uint16 message_length, 
02885     Uint8 *message, 
02886     Uint8 *hash,
02887 #ifdef CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API
02888     Uint32 *request_id,Uint32 dev_id);
02889 #else
02890     Uint32 *request_id);
02891 #endif
02892 
02893 #endif
02894 #define INC32(a)        {\
02895             Uint32 __tmp__    = (Uint32)a;\
02896             __tmp__    = (__tmp__ + 1)&0xffffffffL;\
02897             a       = __tmp__;\
02898          }
02899 
02900 #endif /*CSP1_KERNEL */
